solution_line_template: Phil started with {initial_coins}, and doubled this amount the next year for {initial_coins}*{doubling_factor}=<<{initial_coins}*{doubling_factor}={coins_after_doubling}>>{coins_after_doubling} coins

Phil then collected {coins_per_month_year2} per month the following year, and since there are {months_per_year} months in a year that was {coins_per_month_year2}*{months_per_year}=<<{coins_per_month_year2}*{months_per_year}={coins_added_year2}>>{coins_added_year2} coins added

Phil then collected {coins_per_collection_event_year3} every third month, and since there are {months_per_year} months that means he collected one every {months_per_year}/{collection_frequency_months_year3}={collection_events_per_year_year3} months, for {coins_added_year3} coins added

Before he lost a quarter of his coins, Phil had {coins_after_doubling}+{coins_added_year2}+{coins_added_year3} coins, or <<{coins_after_doubling}+{coins_added_year2}+{coins_added_year3}={total_coins_before_loss}>>{total_coins_before_loss} coins in total.
Losing a quarter of {total_coins_before_loss} coins means Phill lost {total_coins_before_loss}/{loss_denominator}=<<{total_coins_before_loss}/{loss_denominator}={coins_lost}>>{coins_lost} coins
That means Phil had {total_coins_before_loss}-{coins_lost}= <<{total_coins_before_loss}-{coins_lost}={remaining_coins}>>{remaining_coins} coins remaining
